description: '''Dan Sane''' (possibly September 22, 1896 – February 18, 1956) was an American [[Memphis blues]] and [[country blues]] [[guitarist]] and [[songwriter]]. He was an associate of [[Frank Stokes (musician)|Frank Stokes]]. According to the [[music journalism|Music journalist]] Jason Ankeny, "they had emerged among the most complementary duos in all of the blues, with Sane's flatpicking ideally embellished by Stokes' fluid rhythms." The best-known of the songs written by Sane are "Downtown Blues" and "Mr. Crump Don't Like It." His surname was sometimes spelled "Sain".
